titleStmt.title: (Copy of) list of priests and temple inventory
titleStmt.author: Orsenouphis

revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: (From) Orsenouphis, priest of the great great god Soknobraisis of the village Bakchias, meris of Herakleides. List of priests and inventory of the temple for the current year, the twelfth. Among the things in the temple are a wooden gilded shrine of Soknobraisis and a gilded shrine of Pnepheros, fifteen trumpet-shaped bronze lampstands, one bronze censer, one bronze vessel, ten bronze cups, one bronze trumpet, two wooden pipes with seven bronze bands each, two gilded wooden plates, one bronze vessel(?). ...the priests, one by one ..., Sisois (?) (son of Orsenouphis and 34 years old?)

listBibl.bibl: P.Bacch. 4 SB VI 9336 P.Lund. III 5 BL III, 105 (line 13); BL IV, 48 (lines 15, 16); TM 14154; Wilcken, U., Archiv für Papyrusforschung 13 (1939) p. 233; Waddell, W. G., The classical review, Vol. 54 (1940), No 1, p. 47-48; Hombert, M., Chronique d'Égypt 14, 1939, p. 400-401; Schmidt, K. F. W., Philologische Wochenschrift (Jahrgang) 60 (No 45/48), 1940, c. 608-611; van Groningen, B. A., Museum, Maandblad voor Philologie en Geschiedenis, 47, 1940, c. 168
